cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor:
Burl, scurf, and bower
Birth fern and flower.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Verdant Touch
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: The land is still a land and retains all its abilities, plus any other characteristics.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land.

cards.name: Verdigris
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Wall of Blossoms
cards.text:
Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.
cards.originalText:
Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Acidic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to any target."
cards.flavor: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Crystalline Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.

rulings.text: The ability only applies while this card is on the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Dracoplasm
cards.text:
Flying
As Dracoplasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of creatures. Dracoplasm's power becomes the total power of those creatures and its toughness becomes their total toughness.
{R}: Dracoplasm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
As Dracoplasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of creatures. Dracoplasm's power becomes the total power of those creatures and its toughness becomes their total toughness.
{R}: Dracoplasm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hibernation Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."
cards.flavor: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."

cards.name: Selenia, Dark Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Pay 2 life: Return Selenia, Dark Angel to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "I am light. I am dark. I must give my life to serve; not even death can release me."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Pay 2 life: Return Selenia, Dark Angel to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sliver Queen
cards.text: {2}: Create a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token.
cards.flavor: Her children are ever part of her.
cards.originalText: {2}: Put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Soltari Guerrillas
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{0}: The next time Soltari Guerrillas would deal combat damage to an opponent this turn, it deals that damage to target creature instead.

rulings.text: Regardless of when the ability is activated, it will apply to the defending player at the time Soltari Guerrillas tries to deal combat damage to them.

cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{0}: The next time Soltari Guerrillas would deal combat damage to an opponent this turn, it deals that damage to target creature instead.

cards.name: Spined Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

rulings.text: If two Spined Slivers are on the battlefield then each blocked sliver gets +2/+2 for each creature blocking it.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Vhati il-Dal
cards.text: {T}: Until end of turn, target creature has base power 1 or base toughness 1.
cards.flavor:
"Sir, I just thought . . . ," explained Vhati.
"Don't think," interrupted Greven. "It doesn't suit you."

rulings.text: You don't choose whether to affect the targeted creature's power or its toughness until the ability resolves.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.originalText: {T}: Until end of turn, target creature has base power 1 or base toughness 1.

cards.name: Victual Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."
cards.flavor: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."

cards.name: Wood Sage
cards.text: {T}: Choose a creature card name. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.originalText: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Coiled Tinviper
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Cursed Scroll
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a card name, then reveal a card at random from your hand. If that card has the chosen name, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren't any). Since the named card wasn't revealed, no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Emmessi Tome
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Erratic Portal
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Grindstone
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.
cards.flavor:
"Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."
—Crovax

rulings.text: If the two cards are both colorless, then the effect does not repeat. It only repeats if both cards have at least one color and at least one color is shared between them.
The effect repeats as many times as it takes to meet the end condition.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.

cards.name: Jinxed Idol
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.
cards.flavor: "Here."

rulings.text: Your opponent can use the ability to give this card back to you.

The control-change effect has no duration. The targeted player retains control of Jinxed Idol until the game ends, Jinxed Idol leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of it (perhaps because Jinxed Idol's ability is activated again).

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.

cards.name: Lotus Petal
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Metallic Sliver
cards.flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Mox Diamond
cards.text:
If Mox Diamond would enter the battlefield, you may discard a land card instead. If you do, put Mox Diamond onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: If you don't discard a land card, Mox Diamond never enters the battlefield. It won't trigger abilities that look for something entering the battlefield, and you won't get the opportunity to tap it for mana.

cards.originalText:
If Mox Diamond would enter the battlefield, you may discard a land card instead. If you do, put Mox Diamond onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Patchwork Gnomes
cards.text: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.
cards.flavor:
"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor:
"They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."
—Volrath

cards.name: Skyshaper
cards.text: Sacrifice Skyshaper: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It'll get us to the portal, but I can't guarantee what it'll do to the ship."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Skyshaper: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Telethopter
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After losing several of the devices to midair collisions, Greven forbade moggs from operating telethopters.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.

Flying

cards.name: Stalking Stones
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land.

cards.name: Aven Trooper
cards.text:
Flying

cards.flavor: The very skies seethe with the aven's hatred for the Cabal.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{W}, Discard a card from your hand: Aven Trooper gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cleansing Meditation
cards.text:
Destroy all enchantments.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy all enchantments, then return all cards in your graveyard destroyed this way to the battlefield.

rulings.text: Auras returning to the battlefield are placed on any legal permanent of your choice. Doing this does not target the permanent. If there is no legal permanent for an Aura, it remains in the graveyard.

Auras returning to the battlefield can only enchant something that was already on the battlefield. An Enchant Enchantment returning to the battlefield can't be placed on an enchantment that is also in the process of returning to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Destroy all enchantments.
Threshold Instead destroy all enchantments, then return to play all cards in your graveyard destroyed this way. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Equal Treatment
cards.text:
If any source would deal 1 or more damage to a permanent or player this turn, it deals 2 damage to that permanent or player instead.
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
If any source would deal 1 or more damage to a creature or player this turn, it deals 2 damage to that creature or player instead.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Floating Shield
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Floating Shield enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Floating Shield.
Sacrifice Floating Shield: Target creature gains protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
As Floating Shield comes into play, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Floating Shield.
Sacrifice Floating Shield: Target creature gains protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

cards.text:
Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: By definition, madness ends in one of two ways: clarity . . . or death.

Destroy target enchantment.
Madness {W} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

cards.name: Morningtide
cards.text: Exile all cards from all graveyards.
cards.flavor:
"The spirits of the righteous shall rise into the sky. Even dirtwalkers will fly like aven."
—Major Teroh
cards.originalText: Remove all cards in all graveyards from the game.

cards.name: Mystic Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black.
cards.flavor: They soar, and the mystics follow.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Threshold Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Pay No Heed
cards.text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Inhale life. Exhale pain."
—Mystic elder

rulings.text: Pay No Heed doesn't target anything. You can choose a source with hexproof, for example. You choose the damage source as Pay No Heed resolves.
If the chosen source is a permanent spell, damage dealt later in the turn by the permanent it becomes will also be prevented.

cards.originalText: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.name: Possessed Nomad
cards.text:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Nomad gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature."
cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Possessed Nomad to tap.
Threshold Possessed Nomad gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Reborn Hero
cards.text:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Reborn Hero has "When Reborn Hero dies, you may pay {W}{W}. If you do, return Reborn Hero to the battlefield under your control."

rulings.text: You must already have seven or more cards in your graveyard before Reborn Hero is put into the graveyard in order for its Threshold ability to trigger; you don't include Reborn Hero itself in the count.

cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Reborn Hero to tap.
Threshold When Reborn Hero is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {W}{W}. If you do, return Reborn Hero to play under your control. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Spirit Flare
cards.text:
Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, it deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature an opponent controls.
Flashback—{1}{W}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: If either target is illegal when the spell resolves, it will do no damage.

cards.originalText:
Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, it deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature an opponent controls.
Flashback—{1}{W}, Pay 3 life. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Stern Judge
cards.text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Swamp they control.
cards.flavor: "How to punish the guilty is up to the Ancestor. Deciding who merits such punishment is up to me."
cards.originalText: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each swamp he or she controls.

cards.name: Strength of Isolation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has protection from black.
Madness {W} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: Don't mistake isolation for safety.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has protection from black.
Madness {W} (You may play this card for its madness cost at the time you discard it from your hand.)

cards.name: Teroh's Faithful
cards.text: When Teroh's Faithful enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: The light of reason follows them even into battle.
cards.originalText: When Teroh's Faithful comes into play, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Teroh's Vanguard
cards.text:
Flash
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Teroh's Vanguard has "When Teroh's Vanguard enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain protection from black until end of turn."
cards.originalText:
You may play Teroh's Vanguard any time you could play an instant.
Threshold When Teroh's Vanguard comes into play, creatures you control gain protection from black until end of turn. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Transcendence
cards.text:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
When you have 20 or more life, you lose the game.
Whenever you lose life, you gain 2 life for each 1 life you lost. (Damage dealt to you causes you to lose life.)

rulings.text: If your life total is 20 or more and you control an effect that states "you can't lose the game", then an infinite loop is formed. If neither player wants to end the loop by removing one of these two cards from the battlefield, the game ends in a draw.

cards.originalText:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
When you have 20 or more life, you lose the game.
Whenever you lose life, you gain 2 life for each 1 life you lost. (Damage dealt to you causes you to lose life.)

cards.name: Vengeful Dreams
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X cards.
Exile X target attacking creatures.
cards.flavor: Teroh dreams of his enemies' doom.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Vengeful Dreams, discard X cards from your hand.
Remove X target attacking creatures from the game.

cards.name: Alter Reality
cards.text:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

cards.originalText:
Change the text of target permanent or spell by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
Flashback {1}{U} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Ambassador Laquatus
cards.text: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"He smiles with poisoned lips."
—Empress Llawan
cards.originalText: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Aquamoeba
cards.text: Discard a card: Switch Aquamoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Some tides need no moon.

rulings.text: Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.originalText: Discard a card from your hand: Switch Aquamoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Balshan Collaborator
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Balshan Collaborator gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Power, gold, crackers—every bird has its price."
—Chainer, dementia master
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Balshan Collaborator gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Breakthrough
cards.text: Draw four cards, then choose X cards in your hand and discard the rest.
cards.flavor: The ideas came flooding in so fast that they couldn't all be contained.
cards.originalText: Draw four cards, then choose X cards in your hand and discard the rest from it.

cards.name: Cephalid Aristocrat
cards.text: Whenever Cephalid Aristocrat becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It's easy to tell the difference between the devious cephalids and the trustworthy ones. The trustworthy ones are dead.
cards.originalText: Whenever Cephalid Aristocrat becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Cephalid Illusionist
cards.text:
Whenever Cephalid Illusionist becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
{2}{U}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target creature you control this turn.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Cephalid Illusionist becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
{2}{U}, {T}: This turn prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target creature you control.

cards.name: Cephalid Sage
cards.text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Cephalid Sage has "When Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard two cards."

rulings.text: You draw three cards and discard two cards all while Cephalid Sage's ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

If you don't have enough cards in your graveyard at the moment Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, its threshold ability won't trigger. If the number of cards in your graveyard changes and Cephalid Sage loses the ability once it has triggered, the ability will still resolve.

cards.originalText: Threshold When Cephalid Sage comes into play, draw three cards, then discard two cards from your hand. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Cephalid Snitch
cards.text: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The cautious are wary of their enemies. The wise are also wary of their friends.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.

cards.name: Cephalid Vandal
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a shred counter on Cephalid Vandal. Then put the top card of your library into your graveyard for each shred counter on Cephalid Vandal.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a shred counter on Cephalid Vandal. Then put the top card of your library into your graveyard for each shred counter on Cephalid Vandal.
